main event: An unidentified flying object was observed over Exeter, New Hampshire on October 21, 1955.
interesting points: The object was described as stationary, round, and appeared to be red and orange in color.
The object remained stationary during the one-minute observation.
The observation was made by both civilian and military (Ground Observer Corps) witnesses.
On October 22, 1955, a separate report describes a fast-moving, bright object that was observed for 15 minutes before disappearing.
The Project Blue Book report was inconclusive, with the conclusions listing several possible explanations such as a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical object.
sighted object: A stationary, round object that appeared red and orange in color
